meanings.definition: All of the people born and living at about the same time
meanings.sent1: My grandparents, parents, and I belong to the same generation.
meanings.sent2: The younger generation is more tech-savvy than the older one.
meanings.sent3: In our family, each generation seems to get taller than the last!
meanings.sent4: The generation of students today faces challenges that were unheard of in the past.
meanings.sent5: The generation raised during wartime developed a strong sense of resilience.

meanings.definition: The average length of time between the birth of parents and the birth of their children
meanings.sent1: My parents' generation had children at a younger age than mine.
meanings.sent2: The generation gap between my dad and me is quite significant.
meanings.sent3: It seems like each generation in our family is having kids later and later.
meanings.sent4: The generation of my grandparents had larger age gaps between siblings.
meanings.sent5: The average generation length has been increasing over the years due to various factors.

meanings.definition: A single stage in the development of a type of product
meanings.sent1: The latest generation of smartphones has impressive new features.
meanings.sent2: Our company is working on the next generation of eco-friendly packaging.
meanings.sent3: I can't wait to see what the next generation of electric cars will look like!
meanings.sent4: The new generation of gaming consoles promises unparalleled graphics.
meanings.sent5: Each generation of laptops seems to be thinner and more powerful than the last.
